p:
The samplingDecl element holds a prose description of the rationale and methods used in selecting texts, or parts of text, for inclusion in the resource.
The samplingDecl element should include information about such matters as: - the size of individual samples - the method or methods by which they were selected - the underlying population being sampled - the object of the sampling procedure used but is not restricted to these. It may also include a simple description of any parts of the source text included or excluded: A sampling declaration which applies to more than one text or division of a text need not be repeated in the header of each such text. Instead, the@declsattribute of each text (or subdivision of the text) to which the sampling declaration applies may be used to supply a cross-reference to it, as further described in section .
